skill.description: Configure Static Application Security Testing (SAST) tools for automated vulnerability detection in application code. Use when setting up security scanning, implementing DevSecOps practices, or automating code vulnerability detection.
skill.summary: Configure Static Application Security Testing (SAST) tools for automated vulnerability detection in ...

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only guidance and example commands for configuring SAST tools. No executable code, file access, network calls, or command execution patterns detected. Behavior matches stated purpose.

content.user_title: Configure SAST tools for secure code scanning
content.value_statement: You need consistent SAST tool setup across your projects. This skill provides guidance for configuring Semgrep, SonarQube, and CodeQL with custom rules and CI integration.
actual_capabilities: Guide Semgrep configuration and custom rule creation
Explain SonarQube quality gates and security profiles
Outline CodeQL setup and query development workflows
Provide CI pipeline and pre-commit integration examples
Describe false positive tuning and performance optimization
limitations: Does not run scans or install tools automatically
Does not access your repositories or modify CI settings
Does not guarantee compliance certification outcomes
Requires you to configure tool-specific credentials

use_cases.title: SAST baseline rollout
use_cases.description: Plan and configure Semgrep, SonarQube, and CodeQL for an initial organization baseline scan.

use_cases.title: CI pipeline integration
use_cases.description: Add SAST checks to GitHub Actions or GitLab CI with clear failure gates.

use_cases.title: Custom rule authoring
use_cases.description: Create targeted rules to detect risky patterns in a specific codebase.

prompt_templates.title: Beginner setup
prompt_templates.scenario: New SAST setup for a small repo
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up a basic Semgrep scan for a Python project and suggest a minimal CI step.

prompt_templates.title: Pipeline hardening
prompt_templates.prompt: Define a CI workflow that blocks merges on critical SAST findings and keeps noise low.

prompt_templates.title: Rule tuning
prompt_templates.prompt: Suggest rule tuning and path exclusions to reduce false positives in a large monorepo.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced multi-tool
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a plan to combine Semgrep, SonarQube, and CodeQL with clear ownership and reporting.

output_examples.input: Create a SAST plan for a JavaScript monorepo using Semgrep and CodeQL.
output: Select Semgrep auto rules plus OWASP Top Ten pack for JavaScript.
Run CodeQL on main branches and pull requests with SARIF upload.
Exclude build and vendor directories to improve scan time.
Fail the build only on critical and high findings.

best_practices: Start with a baseline scan and prioritize critical issues first
Document suppressions and review them regularly
Cache dependencies and use incremental scans for speed
anti_patterns: Blocking merges on low severity findings
Scanning generated or vendor code by default

faq.question: Which platforms does this skill support?
faq.answer: It provides guidance for Semgrep, SonarQube, and CodeQL across common CI platforms.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It does not execute scans or modify your CI configuration directly.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my existing CI pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, it offers examples for GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, and pre-commit hooks.

faq.question: Is my data accessed or stored?
faq.answer: No, the skill content is static documentation and does not access files or transmit data.

faq.question: How do I troubleshoot noisy results?
faq.answer: Use rule tuning, path exclusions, and documented suppressions to reduce noise.

faq.question: How does it compare to using one tool only?
faq.answer: It helps plan a multi-tool approach for stronger coverage and defense in depth.
